tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE WindTurbineEnergyProduction (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  turbine_id INT,
  production_time TIMESTAMPTZ,
  energy_produced FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE wind_turbine_settings (
  turbine_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  max_power_output DECIMAL,
  min_power_output DECIMAL,
  rotor_diameter DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE turbine_status (
  status_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  turbine_id UUID REFERENCES wind_turbine_settings(turbine_id),
  power_output DECIMAL,
  wind_speed DECIMAL,
  blade_angle DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE energy_production (
  production_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  turbine_id UUID REFERENCES wind_turbine_settings(turbine_id),
  date_time TIMESTAMP,
  energy_generated DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE turbine (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   location VARCHAR(255),
   power_output DECIMAL,
   status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE power_station (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   location VARCHAR(255),
   capacity DECIMAL,
   status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE energy_production (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   turbine_id INT,
   production_time TIMESTAMP,
   energy_produced DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_log (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   turbine_id INT,
   maintenance_date DATE,
   description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE WindTurbine (
    turbine_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    status VARCHAR(50),
    production_capacity FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE TurbineData (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    turbine_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    wind_speed FLOAT,
    power_output FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE MaintenanceLog (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    turbine_id INT,
    maintenance_date DATE,
    details TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyConsumption (
    consumption_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    energy_consumed FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE WeatherData (
    weather_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT
)
